; Mon, 16 Oct 2023 19:25:03 +0800 纪录片《巢》：互相折磨的两代人，为什么还要住在一起http://www.infzm.com/contents/258684
;;2023-10-16 18:00:00;
;

;Fang Junrui, the protagonist of the documentary "The Nest", initially took the initiative to walk up to the director Qin Xiaoyue. In 2016, at the screening of Qin Xiaoyue's first film "The World and Me", Fang Junrui stayed until the end, blushing and stammering, telling Qin Xiaoyue that he wanted to restore cultural relics, but reality did not allow it.

;

;Looking at this peer who was a bit socially anxious and stuttered, Qin Xiaoyue noticed that there was a strong dramatic tension in his expression. Fang Junrui said that doing cultural relic restoration work requires a certain financial foundation. He feels that his family's conditions are not enough to support him, but at the same time, he is also very proud that his family has a house next to Jing'an Temple in Shanghai.

;

;Qin Xiaoyue and the photographer entered the family with cameras. It was a 30-square-meter husband's house, where Jun Rui, born in 1985, lived with his parents, who were over 70 years old. The largest room is the living room, which is also Fang Junrui's bedroom. It has a bed, a dining table, and a recliner for his father to watch TV. Fang Junrui kept buying books on art, religion, and literature, filling the gaps in the furniture.

;

;;

;

;Differences in concepts and dependence in life are the daily life of Fang Junrui (middle) and his parents. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Fang Junrui was deeply influenced by his father who loved calligraphy and painting. When he was in college, he chose cultural relics. Professional restoration. After graduation, the father and son discovered that this was an industry that required high academic qualifications and strong financial support. In the two years after graduating in 2014, Fang Junrui not only failed to find a suitable job, but none of the other jobs he found lasted more than three months.

;

;Father continued to support Fang Junrui, helped him pay the high tuition fees, and signed up for a master class in cultural relic restoration. Fang Junrui took it intermittently and also repaired a bowl, but he never finished it. Constantly hitting the wall swallowed up Fang Junrui's hope. He fell into depression and melancholy, indulged in pure fantasy, and lived a life that was reversed day and night.

;

;Fang Junrui’s father did not live the life he wanted when he was young. He liked painting, but failed to make it a career; he wrote good poems and articles, but he was depressed for a long time.

;

;Qin Xiaoyue originally planned to film the mental journey of a boy who loves the restoration of cultural relics. But as soon as she stepped into their home, she felt that this expectation was completely disappointed. The camera was like a match, igniting the conflicts they had suppressed for many years. In the first few shoots, apart from quarrels, there was almost nothing captured. The direction of the film has completely changed.

;

;At a post-screening talk in Guangzhou on September 16, 2023, an audience member asked about the reason for the naming of "The Nest". In his understanding, "The Nest" is closer to people's imagination of a beautiful family, but The film shows a trapped family, which reminded him of a "cage."

;

; "The nest is not only the feeling of a very warm family, but also the feeling of always living under the wings of the parents, and the expectation that he will always fantasize about when he can leave the nest." Qin Xiaoyue responded. , "His spiritual world is also a nest. He used these books to build a nest for his spiritual world, which is in great contrast with the nest in the real world."

;

;;

;

;Thirty Fang Junrui, who is many years old, lives with his parents, who are over 70 years old, in an old house of 30 square meters. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Liu Wenrong, a researcher at the Shanghai Academy of Social Sciences, has been investigating the intergenerational dynamics of Chinese society for more than ten years Regarding relationship issues, in her opinion, "The Nest" shows typical family intergenerational relationships during the transition period: "Although parents are very unhappy, in fact, the children in this structure are also very unhappy. The reason why everyone resonates is Because the film reflects the current common dilemma of young people growing up, they all feel that they have a strong pursuit of self-realization but are powerless. From a sociological perspective, this phenomenon is a phenomenon unique to us when modernization and social development have reached a certain stage. The result of the intergenerational solidarity culture of familism and the culture of parent-child integration."

;

;Triangle

;

;When photographing this family, Qin Xiao wanted to explore more and more, the people living under the same roof Although they clearly hurt and tortured each other, what allowed them to continue living together. In an interview with a reporter from Southern Weekend, she revealed her answer: "Maybe they have very little and only have each other. If they throw away even this, they will have nothing."

;

;The three of them rarely go out. When traveling, your social circle is also narrow. Except for the occasional visit by her mother to visit relatives, most of the time they spend all day in each other's home. Qin Xiaoyue described this family as a "stable triangular structure", "everyone is dependent and tortured."

;

;The negative attitude common in East Asian families is passed down from generation to generation. Fang Junrui's grandfather was imprisoned for offending a prison guard when he was young, and his father looked down upon him very much. During the "Cultural Revolution", his father encountered the "Going to the Countryside Movement" and needed to go to the frontier. As soon as the mobilization people came, he ran away, forming a Fang Junrui also looked down on his father because of his evasive and fearful temperament.

;

;My father often communicated with Fang Junrui in a suppressive way. When Fang Junrui complained that he could not find his ideal job, his father would say that he had suffered so many injustices and the conditions were so difficult, but he still came through and still insisted on painting. He accused his son of not working hard and only sleeping all day long. , don’t fight for it. Fang Junrui talked about his reading scope and said that sculpture is also one of the areas of interest. His father started by saying: "Sculpture? Do you know sculpture? What do you know?"

;

;This made Fang Junrui in The already cramped home made him feel even more suffocated. He collapsed several times in front of the camera and even threatened to commit suicide.

;

;But at the same time, the care in life is meticulous. Every month, Fang Junrui can get 3,000 yuan from his father. When he needs it, food and clean towels will always be handed to him. When the unpacked books are thrown on the ground, someone will help pick them up. Despite the suffering, Fang Junrui never chose to leave his parents and live alone.

;

;After watching "The Nest", someone shared his understanding with Qin Xiaoyue: The father has never had a sense of presence in society, so he has to make up for it in educating his son. He tried to set rules for the cat he adopted at home, but the cat was not tamed after being beaten, and continued to pace calmly around the dinner table. Fang Junrui is also "immune" to his father's advice.

;

;Facing the camera, the mother does not have as strong a desire to express herself as the father and son. Most of the time, she silently takes care of the housework. The adopted cats came and went, and while the mother fed them food, she lovingly called each one by the name she had given them. "It seems that my mother has always been a person with infinite care, but she actually swallowed her grievances most of the time." Qin Xiaoyue remembered that later in the filming, perhaps because of the camera, Fang Junrui's mother confided all her grievances He came out and pointed at the camera, "Let them judge."

;

;Fang Junrui's mother angrily told her father and son that she wanted to leave them and travel by herself, but in the end she fell back on "If you don't go, I won't go."

;

;;

;

;Fang Junrui’s mother. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;In the film, Fang Junrui’s mother revealed a past incident. Fang Junrui went to junior high school. I once asked to raise a puppy, but my father didn't agree. She believes that since this incident, her originally bright son "has lost his mind and has become broken." The two of them, both in their 40s, had a son at an old age, and they doted on Fang Junrui, especially their father, who almost always responded to his requests since childhood. Qin Xiaoyue guessed that Fang Junrui was not satisfied in this matter, could not consider the problem from other people's point of view, could not accept his father's rejection, and his temper may have become paranoid.

;

;Qin Xiaoyue has a younger brother who is more than ten years younger than her and is also loved by her parents. She sometimes uses this to warn her parents. "But I think from the perspective of parents, sometimes there seems to be nothing they can do. They are just manipulated by their children. When you care too much about someone, it is difficult for you to control it, and your life will become more and more out of control. A point that cannot be resolved, and then they are together in pain." 

;

;The appearance of the camera allowed the family to burst out their long-pent-up emotions, and also exposed that the parents have completely different views on educating their sons. Attitude. The father also wanted to use the camera to help his son wake up and change, but the mother thought that it was useless to talk to him, and stimulating him in front of the camera would only make him more confused. At the end of the documentary, the mother said that selling the old house would be enough for her son to live on for a lifetime. The parents' attitudes towards Fang Junrui were like two winds blowing in opposite directions, canceling each other out.

;

;After Fang Junrui quit his security job, he went for air testing. The mother muttered to the father: "Do you have to stand all the time for air testing? It will be very hard." The father said bluntly: "You are so strange. At the same time, you are worried that he will not be able to endure hardship, and now you are afraid that he will endure hardship."

;

;"He is very adaptable in such an environment. He just does his own thing, and someone takes care of him every day. About whether he is awake, the meaning of life, and the motivation of life, such high-level talk falls back to everyone. The day's schedule still consists of eating wontons, cooking, and three meals a day." Qin Xiaoyue told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Considering that Fang Junrui might get married in the future, the two elders bought an affordable house in Jiading, far away from the city center. Not long ago, they just moved Fang Junrui's books to their new house. Qin Xiaoyue hopes to take footage of Fang Junrui or his parents moving out of the old house in the future, which means that there is a high possibility of a breakthrough in the family's stable structure.

;

;Two generations

;

;The Fang family’s ancestors had a prosperous past. During the Republic of China, Fang Junrui’s great-grandfathers moved to Shanghai, opened a rickshaw company, worked as compradors, and lived a prosperous life. A life that is the envy of others. When the Japanese invaded Shanghai, their family fled from Hongkou to the banks of the Suzhou River. They experienced ups and downs in the turbulent times, and by Fang Junrui's father's generation, they were completely in decline.

;

;In stark contrast to the cramped and gray physical space, is the family’s spiritual world. His father loved painting and could write modern poetry, and his mother also read traditional vertical poetry. Fang Junrui was influenced by his ears and eyes, and inherited his interest in literature, history and art. When Fang Junrui took the college entrance examination, it was his father who first discovered "cultural relic restoration" while applying for the major. He spent his monthly salary and the money given by his father to buy books, and talked about Catholic culture and art with his fellow believers in a clear and logical manner.

;

;In Qin Xiaoyue's view, the fates of Fang Junrui and his father are "very similar and parallel." Fang’s father liked painting since he was a child, but he did not have the opportunity to engage in related work. For twenty years, he worked as a waiter in public bathrooms. However, he never gave up this hobby. He would draw at home when he had time. When talents could flow, he switched jobs to work as an artist in a hospital. His main job was to publish blackboard newspapers. He waited until he was allocated a house at the age of 40 before he began to consider getting married and having children. He often says similar words: "How many people can really live an ideal life?"

;

;Unlike his parents' generation who could just take things as they come, Fang Junrui made no secret of the fact that he "wasn't born with the right luck." With a sense of "time", he found a place to blame for his rough life, imagining that if he had good material conditions, he could engage in restoration of cultural relics, get married and have children smoothly.

;

;In my father’s view, if there are no conditions or a house, how can we have friends or get married? Fang Junrui believes that having a house to live in and being able to get married are basic needs that everyone should realize. "Can only rich people get married?"

;

;;

;

;Fang Junrui (right) and his father (left) argue about personal experiences. Stills from the documentary "The Nest". ;(Picture provided by the film producer);

;

;Liu Wenrong analyzed: "My father and he have similar personal ideals, and they are very concerned about career, aesthetics, and There are similarities in the pursuit of art, but because they grew up in different stages of social development, they chose different paths in life. The father put survival first, but the son did not compromise on the path of self-realization and ideal pursuit. They are giants The conflict is the common characteristic of those disunited and disharmonious 'cheating' families - the values ​​cannot match, and the instrumental support of the two generations becomes emotional binding and moral kidnapping."

;

; The father and son suffered similar fates at the same age - due to various reasons, they were unable to live their ideal lives. But instead of cherishing each other, the two built high walls. Fang's father inspired Fang Junrui with his own life experience. The latter did not accept this trick at all and felt that it was nothing special. In the eyes of Fang's father, Fang Junrui is completely unable to take care of himself, and the restoration of cultural relics is just empty talk with high ambitions.

;

;Qin Xiaoyue pointed out that the turbulent times that Fang’s father experienced had destroyed his outlook on life, his feelings about life, and his entire inner order. This resulted in almost all of his cognitions and expressions being passive and conservative. Fang Junrui, like many of his contemporaries, "has not experienced any great pain. He has witnessed the most rapid development stage of the motherland, and has been influenced by many foreign cultures. He has more opportunities and sees more possibilities." , not very good at setting limits for myself.”

;

;The biggest difference between Fang Junrui and his parents is that the latter's living situation is that the whole family has no food if they don't work, while the former has enough food and clothing, and works more for self-realization. When Fang Junrui's ambitions could not be put into practice in society, he was neither willing nor able to immerse himself in survival and accept a mediocre and trivial life like his parents.

;

;The quality of life of those born in the 1980s and 1990s is much higher than that of their parents’ generation. This is the core change in the growth environment of the two generations and the source of intergenerational conflict. Similar to Fang Junrui and his parents, the gap and cognitive differences between generations are common.

;

;"Communication is very important. When communication is not in place, this situation may occur in their family. It feels like they say these words out of love, but these words cannot reach the other person's heart at all. The relationship is there." Qin Xiaoyue said.

;

;Qin Xiaoyue also suffered from the rejection of his parents. At that time, she returned from studying abroad, traveled around China by train, and started making documentaries. In the parents' minds, after their daughter has tried what she wants to do, she should honestly find a class, preferably a TV station or a newspaper, where she will be stable and respectable. Unexpectedly, after Qin Xiaoyue worked on "The Nest" for five or six years, they couldn't figure out why their daughter "jumped into a bigger pit again." During post-production, she had a conflict with her parents. Her mother said to her, "If you continue like this, you will become Fang Junrui."

;

;Qin Xiaoyue looks back on this journey. He has earned every support from his family on his own. If there are achievements in this area, it will best dispel their worries. If there are no results yet, he must at least have enthusiasm and action to impress them. .

;

;The film has been screened in Shanghai, Guangzhou, Hangzhou and other cities. In each scene, Qin Xiaoyue will receive direct resonance from the audience, such as thinking of the way his father speaks, and a friend's family is similar to it. etc. This is exactly what she hopes for - the audience can stop pointing fingers at the characters and use the film as a mirror to reflect their own problems.

;

;A bowl

;

;Fang Junrui never repaired the bowl.

;

;During the first filming, his father asked him to show the bowl to Qin Xiaoyue and the others, and encouraged him to repair the bowl. Maybe the master thought it was good and would be willing to accept him as a disciple.

;

;For the second filming, my father "exposed" Fang Junrui in front of the camera - if he really liked the restoration of cultural relics, this bowl would have been repaired long ago. Qin Xiaoyue followed what he said and waited until he repaired the bowl before coming over to take pictures next time. Fang Junrui's eyes changed and he directly stated that it was impossible to make an inspirational film through him.

;

;;

;

;Fang Junrui has not repaired the bowl for a long time. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Why can’t Fang Junrui repair this small bowl? The audience gave a psychological understanding: for him, the bowl is a symbol of the ideal. If he does not practice, the ideal will always exist; if he practices it, he fails to repair it, or after finishing it, he still cannot find anything related to it. work, then his ideals will be shattered.

;

;The filming and production cycle of "The Nest" far exceeded Qin Xiaoyue's plan. She feels that this film is her bowl. "You really want to do something, and you are very good at doing it, but you have never done it. At this time, you will feel that your life is out of control, and your life path is not what you imagined. It will produce a kind of self-doubt." In her opinion, the film was made by accident. If it had not been made, she would have been in a very helpless state. "If I were absolutely sure about this, I would not do it. Hurry up. Changing careers may not be so painful."

;

;After the film won the Best Documentary Award at the Frist Youth Film Festival, it received a lot of attention, including many workers in the field of cultural relic restoration. Qin Xiaoyue suggested that Fang Junrui take this opportunity Repair the bowl to prove his ability to those who care about him. Fang Junrui responded to her, so what if it was repaired, and he had no time at all now. "Actually, work also has weekends. He was completely immersed in negative emotions and couldn't get out." Qin Xiaoyue said.

;

;The entry barrier for cultural relic restoration is high, and graduate school is usually required, with mentors leading the way. After watching the film, Fang Junrui’s college classmates told Qin Xiaoyue that no one among their classmates had entered the field of cultural relic restoration after graduation. Fang Junrui has tried many jobs, including real estate registration, technical worker, hospital security, etc., but it was always difficult to continue due to work ability, interpersonal relationships, personal wishes and other reasons. Struggling with income and housing issues, he couldn't find a partner.

;

;Liu Wenrong, who grew up in the late 1970s, observed that it is difficult for young people today to be "down to earth". This change in mentality is closely related to the entire social information environment. “The network and information dissemination are too developed, giving people a strong sense of powerlessness. The people they refer to are always the best people, and they have no way to control the people around them. People and things, including those who are satisfied with themselves, live a very unhappy life."

;

;Fang Junrui wanted to live a better life, and imagined that such a life existed in the glorious years of his ancestors. But he couldn't see that the stagnant life in front of him would be loosened in the short term, and he lost his ability to move. Four or five years passed on the screen, and until the end of the film, almost nothing had been resolved. The bowl had not been repaired, a suitable job had not been found, family relations had not eased, and there had been no love or marriage.

;

;Before meeting Fang Junrui, Qin Xiaoyue believed that everyone should live the life they want. He defied her expectations and never became a heroic figure. After struggling for a long time, Qin Xiaoyue accepted this sense of loss and accepted that anyone can be a mediocre person.

;

;"I think what his dad said is right. If you really love something, you will actually try more and won't give up so easily, but no one can To really empathize with him, for example, it would be unfair for him to say this."

;

;She turned to explore the reasons and tried to use documentaries to show part of the answers. The film has been cut one version after another, like answers that are hesitant to speak. The current version involves many issues such as family, destiny, and ideals.

;

;"Maybe no one can explain it clearly. (The reason) is comprehensive. He has certain personal reasons. For example, he is too fragile and gives up too easily. This has nothing to do with the environment in which he grew up. , family relationships, and social environment. For example, he did not encounter the kind of opportunities to support himself to try this aspect, and there was no well-connected and nurturing atmosphere." Qin Xiaoyue overturned his initial plan to shoot a Yu Yu The idea of ​​an ideal young man who is frustrated, "These materials are enough to make a short film. But if I make such a film, it seems that I will ignore the more important influence on him in his life."
